transportAdvice: Taipei has an extensive and efficient metro system that connects most major tourist areas, making it easy to get around without a car. Buses supplement the metro network, taxis are widely available and metered, and many central neighborhoods are very walkable.

weather.description: Cool and overcast with frequent drizzle; pack a light jacket and rain gear.
Similar to January, often grey and damp with occasional cold spells during Lunar New Year.
Temperatures begin to rise but rain remains frequent; expect mild and muggy conditions.
Warm and increasingly humid with regular showers as spring sets in.
Hot and very rainy as the plum rain season approaches; an umbrella is essential.
Hot, humid, and wet with the onset of typhoon season; expect heavy downpours.
The hottest month of the year with intense heat, high humidity, and typhoon risk.
Remains very hot and humid with the highest likelihood of typhoon activity.
Still warm and wet with continued typhoon risk as summer gradually winds down.
Temperatures ease and skies begin to clear; one of the more pleasant months to visit.
Mild and comfortable with lower humidity; a popular time for outdoor sightseeing.
Cool and occasionally rainy; light layers are recommended for comfortable exploration.
